titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New England Church Records
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Martha Lund Smalley, James M. Starr, and Carl L. Beckwith

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:20

did.abstract: Record Group 48 is an open collection composed of records from individual churches in the six New England states.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: New England Church Records (RG 48), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Material in this collection dates from 1640 to 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: At last revision, the collection comprised approximately 23 linear feet of material. A small portion of the material is in manuscript form while the majority is printed, including manuals, directories, news bulletins and historical papers. The churches are arranged alphabetically within each state with name changes and other historical data noted when pertinent. The material for each church is arranged chronologically except in a few cases where the quantity of material warranted a more detailed arrangement. Additional documentation regarding these churches may be available in the Library's cataloged collection.

First Unitarian Universalist Society: Looseleaf notebook: transcripts and copies of historical documents, including: "Records of the First Universalist Society in New Haven (1836) (20 typed pages); "Historical Sketch of the First Universalist Church and Society in New Haven, Conn. (1873) by Phebe Hanaford (20 page pamphlet); "The History of the First Universalist Church" by Lucy Creemer Peckham (1911) (6 typed pages); "History of the Society" compile by Eunice K. Armstead (1936) (1 page); "The Finished Work; of Four Years in New Haven" a farewell sermon by Phebe Hanaford (1874) (14 page typed transcript); Additional histories, list of places of worship, list of ministers.
